member.name: T:Qhta.Unicode.Models.UcdCategory
member.summary: Represents the Unicode character categories as defined by the Unicode Standard.
member.remarks: The enumeration provides a set of named constants that correspond to the general categories of characters in the Unicode character database. These categories are used to classify characters based on their general properties, such as being a letter, number, punctuation, or symbol. This classification is useful for text processing and analysis tasks.

member.name: T:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystem
member.summary: Entity representing a writing system, which can be a script, language, or notation.

member.name: P:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystem.Id
member.summary: Number that uniquely identifies the writing system in the database.

member.name: P:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystem.Name
member.summary: Name of the writing system (in English).

member.name: P:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystem.Type
member.summary: A type of writing system, such as script, language, or notation.

member.name: P:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystem.Kind
member.summary: A kind of writing system, such as alphabet, syllabary, or logographic.

member.name: P:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystem.ParentId
member.summary: Identifier of the parent writing system, if this writing system is a child of another.

member.name: P:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystem.KeyPhrase
member.summary: Key phrase which identifies the writing system in CodePoint Description field. It may contain a wildcard character ('*') which tells the system whether the key phrase is placed at the beginning or at the end of the CodePoint Description field.

member.name: P:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystem.Ctg
member.summary: Unicode Category (Ctg) code, which may be used to classify the writing system using the Ctg field of the CodePoints.

member.name: P:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystem.Iso
member.summary: Standardized ISO code name for the writing system, if applicable.

member.name: P:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystem.Abbr
member.summary: An abbreviation for the writing system used in the target serialization method, if applicable.

member.name: P:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystem.Ext
member.summary: Extension string added to the Abbr field to provide unique identification for the writing system,

member.name: P:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystem.Description
member.summary: Description of the writing system, which explains its meaning.

member.name: P:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystem.ParentSystem
member.summary: An optional parent writing system that this writing system is derived from or associated with. Associated with the ParentId field.

member.name: P:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystem.Children
member.summary: A collection of child writing systems that are derived from or associated with this writing system.

member.name: P:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystem.ChildrenCount
member.summary: A count of the number of child writing systems associated with this writing system. Zero if there are no children.

member.name: P:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystem.UcdBlocks
member.summary: A collection of UcdBlocks that contain code points associated with this writing system.

member.name: T:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemKind
member.summary: Specifies the kind of writing system used to represent language or symbols.
member.remarks: This enumeration categorizes various writing systems based on their structural and functional characteristics. It includes systems such as alphabets, abjads, syllabaries, and more specialized forms like musical notation and stenography.

member.name: F:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemKind.Abjad
member.summary: A writing system in which only consonants are represented, leaving the vowel sounds to be inferred by the reader.

member.name: F:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemKind.Abugida
member.summary: A segmental writing system in which consonant–vowel sequences are written as units; each unit is based on a consonant letter, and vowel notation is secondary, similar to a diacritical mark.

member.name: F:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemKind.Alphabet
member.summary: A standard set of letters written to represent particular sounds in a spoken language, typically including both consonants and vowels.

member.name: F:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemKind.Constructed
member.summary: A language whose phonology, grammar, orthography, and vocabulary, instead of having developed naturally, are consciously devised for some purpose, which may include being devised for a work of fiction.

member.name: F:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemKind.Control
member.summary: A set of characters that control the flow of text, such as line breaks, tabs, and other formatting characters that do not represent written language.

member.name: F:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemKind.Cuneiform
member.summary: A logo-syllabic writing system that was used to write several languages of the Ancient Near East, named for the characteristic wedge-shaped impressions which form their signs.

member.name: F:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemKind.Encoding
member.summary: A set of characters encoding other characters, often used to represent text in a specific format or encoding scheme.

member.name: F:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemKind.Form
member.summary: A set of characters that are used to represent a specific form of writing, such as a script or a style of calligraphy, often with unique stylistic features.

member.name: F:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemKind.Graphical
member.summary: A set of graphical shapes that can be used individually or combined to create grid-based drawings, often used in design and art.

member.name: F:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemKind.Hieroglyphic
member.summary: An ancient writing system that uses pictorial symbols to represent sounds, words, or concepts, primarily associated with the ancient Egyptians.

member.name: F:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemKind.Ideographic
member.summary: A writing system consisting of characters that represent ideas or concepts, rather than specific sounds or words, allowing for a more abstract representation of language.

member.name: F:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemKind.Invisible
member.summary: A set of code points that have no visible presentations, often used for control characters or formatting purposes.

member.name: F:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemKind.Logographic
member.summary: A set of written characters that represents a semantic component of a language, such as a word or morpheme.

member.name: F:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemKind.Mixed
member.summary: Mixed writing systems that combine elements of different types, such as logographic, syllabary, and phonetic systems, to represent language.

member.name: F:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemKind.Musical
member.summary: Musical notation is a system used to visually represent music through symbols, allowing musicians to read and perform compositions.

member.name: F:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemKind.Numerical
member.summary: A writing system for expressing numbers; that is, a mathematical notation for representing numbers of a given set, using digits or other symbols in a consistent manner.

member.name: F:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemKind.Phonetic
member.summary: A writing system that uses symbols to represent the sounds of speech, often used to transcribe languages phonetically, allowing for the representation of pronunciation without regard to the standard orthography of the language.

member.name: F:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemKind.Pictographic
member.summary: A set of graphical symbols that convey meaning through their visual resemblance to physical objects, often used in signage or pictorial communication.

member.name: F:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemKind.SemiSyllabary
member.summary: A writing system that behaves partly as an alphabet and partly as a syllabary, where some characters represent syllables and others represent individual sounds.

member.name: F:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemKind.Stenography
member.summary: An abbreviated symbolic writing method that increases speed and brevity of writing as compared to longhand, a more common method of writing a language.

member.name: F:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemKind.Syllabary
member.summary: A writing system that uses symbols to represent syllables, typically used in languages where syllables are the basic units of meaning, rather than individual sounds or words.

member.name: F:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemKind.Symbolic
member.summary: A writing system that uses a set of symbols to represent a specific domain or set of concepts, often used in specialized fields such as mathematics, chemistry, or computer science.

member.name: F:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemKind.Pictophonetic
member.summary: A writing system that combines ideographic and phonetic elements, often used to represent both the meaning and pronunciation of words in a language.

member.name: T:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemKindEntity
member.summary: Represents an entity that defines a type of writing system.
member.remarks: This class is used to categorize different writing systems by their kind and description.

member.name: P:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemKindEntity.Id
member.summary: Identifier for the writing system kind, represented as a enum.

member.name: P:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemKindEntity.Name
member.summary: Name of the writing system kind.

member.name: P:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemKindEntity.Description
member.summary: Description of the writing system kind.

member.name: T:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemType
member.summary: Enumeration representing different types of writing systems.

member.name: F:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemType.Area
member.summary: A range of code points that are not defined individually

member.name: F:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemType.Family
member.summary: A set of writing systems or scripts that share common characteristics

member.name: F:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemType.Script
member.summary: A script is a set of symbols used to write a language, which may include letters, numbers, punctuation, and other characters.

member.name: F:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemType.Language
member.summary: A language is a structured system of communication that consists of grammar and vocabulary, used by a community for communication.

member.name: F:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemType.Notation
member.summary: Notation is a system of symbols used to represent information in some convention, often used in mathematics, music, or other specialized fields.

member.name: F:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemType.SymbolSet
member.summary: SymbolSet is a collection of symbols that can be used in various contexts. Unlike notation, there are no specific rules for use.

member.name: F:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemType.Subset
member.summary: A subset is a collection of symbols that belongs to a larger set, often used to represent a specific part of that set.

member.name: F:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemType.Artefact
member.summary: An artefact is an object made or modified by humans, often used in archaeology or anthropology to study past cultures.

member.name: T:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemTypeEntity
member.summary: Entity representing a writing system type.

member.name: P:Qhta.Unicode.Models.WritingSystemTypeEntity.Id
member.summary: Identifier for the writing system type, represented as a enum.

member.summary: Name of the writing system type.

member.summary: Description of the writing system type.
